meanings.definition: To make noble or elevate in rank or character.
meanings.sent1: The kind act of helping others can ennobled a person's soul.
meanings.sent2: The king ennobled the brave knight for his valor in battle.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy ennobled the atmosphere with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering determination ennobled her spirit, lifting her above all challenges.
meanings.sent5: The sunset ennobled the sky with its vibrant colors, painting a majestic scene.

meanings.definition: To confer a title of nobility upon.
meanings.sent1: The queen ennobled the loyal servant with the title of Duke.
meanings.sent2: In the ceremony, the king ennobled the brave warrior as a Knight of the Realm.
meanings.sent3: The magician ennobled the rabbit with the title of 'Sir Hops-a-lot'.
meanings.sent4: The prestigious award ennobled her as the 'Champion of Justice'.
meanings.sent5: The crown ennobled him as the 'Defender of the Kingdom', honoring his service.

meanings.sent1: The simple act of kindness can ennobled any interaction.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece ennobled the gallery, drawing admiration from all.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ennobled the park with its acrobatic antics.
meanings.sent4: Her graceful dance ennobled the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: The melody of the song ennobled the air, filling hearts with joy.
